member.summary: Is the operation recurring.

member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Common.BackgroundOperation
member.summary: A background operation, that can be used to run a method in a background task. The method can be run at given intervals. Runs only one method at a time. Will delay the next run, if previous run is still ongoing.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Common.BackgroundOperation.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Action{MFiles.VAF.Common.BackgroundOperation})
member.summary: Creates a new background operation that runs the method in separate task.
member.param: The name of the vault where this background operation is running.
The name of the background operation.
The cancellation token, that is used to cancel the running background operation.
The method to invoke. The background operation will be passed to the method.

member.summary: Runs the operation at once or immediately after the current run is finished.

member.summary: Runs the operation at once or immediately after the current run is finished.
member.param: The run once request will not be made, if there are already more than equal requests to the given maximum.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Common.BackgroundOperation.RunAtIntervals(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Begins running the operation at given intervals. If a run takes longer than the interval, the next run starts immediately after the previous run.

member.summary: Stops running the operation at intervals.

member.returns: False, if the maximum waiting time was reached.

member.summary: A method to change the status of the background operation. The provided status changing action is run inside a lock and the state will change accordingly.

member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference
member.summary:
The Complex Placeholder - Available Triggers that can perform logical actions against an object in order to retrieve an Object.
These Items Modify the Base Context Object.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.UNINITIALIZED
member.summary: Default UNINITIALIZED Value.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.PARENT
member.summary: Returns the 'Default Owner'

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.PREVIOUSVERSION
member.summary: Returns the Previous Version of An Object Usage Sample: %PREVIOUSVERSION_3.PROPERTY_0% Returns the Name or Title of the Object 3 versions ago.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.SPECIFICVERSION
member.summary: Returns a specific Version of An Object Usage Sample: %SPECIFICVERSION_3.PROPERTY_0% Returns the Name or Title of the Object at version 3.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.RELATEDFROMOBJECT
member.summary: Performs a call to GetRelationships( Object Type = Provided ID, Relation Type = FromThisObject ) Returns the resulting Lookups collection. Usage Sample: %FOREACH( #{ %RELATEDFROMOBJECT_0% }, #{ This is a related object %PROPERTY_0% } )%

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.RELATEDTOOBJECT
member.summary: Performs a call to GetRelationships( Object Type = Provided ID, Relation Type = ToThisObject ) Returns the resulting Lookups collection. Usage Sample: %FOREACH( #{ %RELATEDTOOBJECT_0% }, #{ This is a related object %PROPERTY_0% } )%

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.RELATEDFROMCLASS
member.summary: Performs a call to GetRelationships( Class = Provided ID, Relation Type = FromThisObject ) Returns the resulting Lookups collection. Usage Sample: %FOREACH( #{ %RELATEDFROMCLASS_0% }, #{ This is a related object %PROPERTY_0% } )%

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.RELATEDTOCLASS
member.summary: Performs a call to GetRelationships( Object Type = Provided ID, Relation Type = ToThisObject ) Returns the resulting Lookups collection. Usage Sample: %FOREACH( #{ %RELATEDTOCLASS_0% }, #{ This is a related object %PROPERTY_0% } )%

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.ComplexReference.RELATIONSHIPS

The Simple Reference - Available Triggers that can perform a logical actions against an object in order to retrieve an object or lookup reference.

member.summary: Default UNINITIALIZED Value.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.PropertyReference.PROPERTY
member.summary: Returns the Display Value or the Property in the Triggering Object. Usage Sample: This Object just is in state %PROPERTY_39%. Returns the workflow state for the current object.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Common.ReferenceTree.PropertyReference.OLDPROPERTY
member.summary: Returns the Display Value or the Property in the Triggering Objects Previous Version. Usage Sample: This Object just existed state %OLDPROPERTY_39%. Returns the workflow state for the version just before the current one.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Common.VaultObjectOperationsExtensionMethods.GetObjectVersionAndPropertiesOfMultipleObjectsInBatches(MFilesAPI.VaultObjectOperations,MFilesAPI.ObjVers,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resolves the in batches.
member.param: The object version identifiers of the object versions for which the information is requested.
True to return the latest available versions of the objects. If 'AllowCheckedOut' is false, the latest checked in version is returned.
If true, a checked out object version can be returned. If false, only checked in version are allowed.

True if the method is allowed to return less results than what is requested. This can happen if all object versions could not be found or if the user does not have access to them. If false, the method raises an error if all object versions were not found.
True if the information should always be updated from the server. If false, the client local cache may be used. This flag is relevant only when M-Files API is used in client mode.

member.summary: Setting in new license content. Gets called after application instantiation before Initialize(), and also when a new license is applyed from MF-Admin.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.ILicensedVaultApplication.GetApplicationLicenseStatus(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Called by platform, at any time, to request the license status, either currently set license or the one given as argument. Returning the value MFApplicationLicenseStatusFormatError for a new license will prevent the user from saving that license into the database. Make this method as fast as possible.
member.param: Use given license content instead of currently loaded.
If newlicense=true, return status of this license content.
member.returns: Enumeration status

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.ILicensedVaultApplication.GetApplicationLicenseDetails(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Called by platform, at any time, to request the license details text, either currenly set license or the one given as argument. Make this method as fast as possible.
member.param: Use given license content instead of currently loaded.
If newlicense=true, return status of this license content.
member.returns: Details text

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.VaultApplicationBase.ConvertToLocalVault(MFilesAPI.Vault,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Overridable factory method for local vault objects. Converts the vault object to locally used and possibly stored vault object. This method allows the implementations to improve the performance by using in-process vault. Overriding functionality may e.g. implement local caching features to the vault.
member.param: True if the vault object should be prepared for persisting.
member.returns: The converted vault object.

member.summary: Creates the metadata structure cache for the given vault. If the caching is not desired then this method should be overridden and it should return null.
member.param: Tells if the cache should be refreshed or re-created before returning it.
member.returns: The metadata structure cache object for the given vault or null is cache is not used.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.VaultApplicationBase.CreateMetadataStructureCacheEventSink(MFilesAPI.Vault,MFiles.VAF.MetadataCache.IMetadataStructureCacheUpdate)
member.summary: Creates the metadata structure cache event sink that can be used to update the cache based on events. Currently only updating the users, user groups and logins is supported. If one does not want to register the event handlers and update the cache then this method should be overridden and it should return null.
member.param: The updatable cache pobject that should be the target of the updates.
member.returns: The created cache updater object or null if cache updating is not wanted.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Placeholders.ObjVerExReadCache.Resolve(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{MFiles.VAF.Common.ObjVerEx},MFilesAPI.SessionInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resolves a set of loaded ObjVerEx instances from the ones provided. If an instance is already cached, it is returned. If a passed instance is loaded (but not cached), it will be cached and returned. If a passed instance is not loaded (and not cached), it will be loaded, cached and returned. If an instance does not exist it is removed from the list.
member.param: References to the objects to load.
The current user session if applicable (can be null).
Indicates whether missing ObjVerEx's will cause an error, or simply not load.
